body:
Hi guys Kek responded to some of our concerns tonight and I went to the discord to talk a little more and get some confirmation.

All Ruqqus categories will be fixed to be turn on and not hidden by default:

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

body: Yeah the admins themselves aren't in agreement with that it seems. Some categories were being added. It's a mess for sure. I've asked that filtering not happen on mobile until people can see the filters. Kek said they are going to be working on fixing all of that. I have asked about my +MAGA guild not showing, it wasn't being shadowbanned, they were trying to help fix it showing up, it wasn't intentional.

body:
@kek has been reasonable talking to me. Hasn't fixed the problem that today my posts in +Parkour +MakePalestineGreatAgain +Amazon +Freemasonry, +PorcupinesHedgehogsMoles, +MeerkatPrairieDogChipmunk were useless and shadow-banned because they still haven't changed one line of code, so they remain oddly shadow-banned by default...but he's been reasonable talking about it, acknowledging it's a problem, and assuring me that if I just shut up the problem will go away. Of course, I don't trust him until I see the actual results - so I don't shut up...but he even takes that in stride.

But if he spent less time talking to chicks, we wouldn't even know his name ;)

body:
Thank you stars. This all sounds like it is heading in the right direction.

My concern from today is that @DarkForge was targeted for "recategorisation" before the category reset to all "on" had taken place. What could be the reason for this? @sfrohne can confirm this and that there was a "glitch" in the mod logs that did not show who had changed the category of DarkForge's guild.

It is always a good thing to call for a truce - no one wants a war. But the above actions do not demonstrate good faith or common sense to me. It's all good and well for certain people to cry others are unreasonable because their arguments are getting heated (or trying to communicate on mobile while out doing other things) but calm, surreptitious irrationality is no different in my book.

I would've participated in the earlier protest had I been home and able to do so. It was justified.

I would also like to state I agree with @TrumpVoter1 that categories should not be applied to ALL and only the user's HOMEPAGE, and until this can be implemented and mobile issues resolved, all categorisation should be removed.
body_html:
Thank you stars. This all sounds like it is heading in the right direction.

My concern from today is that @DarkForge was targeted for "recategorisation" before the category reset to all "on" had taken place. What could be the reason for this? @sfrohne can confirm this and that there was a "glitch" in the mod logs that did not show who had changed the category of DarkForge's guild.

It is always a good thing to call for a truce - no one wants a war. But the above actions do not demonstrate good faith or common sense to me. It's all good and well for certain people to cry others are unreasonable because their arguments are getting heated (or trying to communicate on mobile while out doing other things) but calm, surreptitious irrationality is no different in my book.

I would've participated in the earlier protest had I been home and able to do so. It was justified.

I would also like to state I agree with @TrumpVoter1 that categories should not be applied to ALL and only the user's HOMEPAGE, and until this can be implemented and mobile issues resolved, all categorisation should be removed.

post.body:
Hi guys Kek responded to some of our concerns tonight and I went to the discord to talk a little more and get some confirmation.

All Ruqqus categories will be fixed to be turn on and not hidden by default:

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

body:
Thank you Stars. For the record I still don't see the point with this change. ALL was not broken. We as users have the ability to filter the users and guilds we don't want to see already and this "fix" does not add to that but does give the admins reddit level power to censor should they so desire. This is completely against their stated free speech principles for Ruqqus.

I have stated multiple times now that dev work of this kind should focus on home to give us more customization. And if categorizations are to be used then apply the functionality for searching guilds by this categorization only just so users can discover similar guilds to subscribe too. Otherwise they make ZERO sense as ALL should be for everything by default unless the end goal is censorship or content manipulation. Just clarifying what the admins are going to do with categories does not go far enough to resolve this as long as they still exist and are still relevant to ALL.

I am sure others feel similarly here on this.
body_html:
Thank you Stars. For the record I still don't see the point with this change. ALL was not broken. We as users have the ability to filter the users and guilds we don't want to see already and this "fix" does not add to that but does give the admins reddit level power to censor should they so desire. This is completely against their stated free speech principles for Ruqqus.

I have stated multiple times now that dev work of this kind should focus on home to give us more customization. And if categorizations are to be used then apply the functionality for searching guilds by this categorization only just so users can discover similar guilds to subscribe too. Otherwise they make ZERO sense as ALL should be for everything by default unless the end goal is censorship or content manipulation. Just clarifying what the admins are going to do with categories does not go far enough to resolve this as long as they still exist and are still relevant to ALL.

I am sure others feel similarly here on this.

post.body:
Hi guys Kek responded to some of our concerns tonight and I went to the discord to talk a little more and get some confirmation.

All Ruqqus categories will be fixed to be turn on and not hidden by default:

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

parent.body:
Thank you stars. This all sounds like it is heading in the right direction.

My concern from today is that @DarkForge was targeted for "recategorisation" before the category reset to all "on" had taken place. What could be the reason for this? @sfrohne can confirm this and that there was a "glitch" in the mod logs that did not show who had changed the category of DarkForge's guild.

It is always a good thing to call for a truce - no one wants a war. But the above actions do not demonstrate good faith or common sense to me. It's all good and well for certain people to cry others are unreasonable because their arguments are getting heated (or trying to communicate on mobile while out doing other things) but calm, surreptitious irrationality is no different in my book.

I would've participated in the earlier protest had I been home and able to do so. It was justified.

I would also like to state I agree with @TrumpVoter1 that categories should not be applied to ALL and only the user's HOMEPAGE, and until this can be implemented and mobile issues resolved, all categorisation should be removed.
parent.body_html:
Thank you stars. This all sounds like it is heading in the right direction.

My concern from today is that @DarkForge was targeted for "recategorisation" before the category reset to all "on" had taken place. What could be the reason for this? @sfrohne can confirm this and that there was a "glitch" in the mod logs that did not show who had changed the category of DarkForge's guild.

It is always a good thing to call for a truce - no one wants a war. But the above actions do not demonstrate good faith or common sense to me. It's all good and well for certain people to cry others are unreasonable because their arguments are getting heated (or trying to communicate on mobile while out doing other things) but calm, surreptitious irrationality is no different in my book.

I would've participated in the earlier protest had I been home and able to do so. It was justified.

I would also like to state I agree with @TrumpVoter1 that categories should not be applied to ALL and only the user's HOMEPAGE, and until this can be implemented and mobile issues resolved, all categorisation should be removed.

Thank you stars. This all sounds like it is heading in the right direction.

My concern from today is that @DarkForge was targeted for "recategorisation" before the category reset to all "on" had taken place. What could be the reason for this? @sfrohne can confirm this and that there was a "glitch" in the mod logs that did not show who had changed the category of DarkForge's guild.

It is always a good thing to call for a truce - no one wants a war. But the above actions do not demonstrate good faith or common sense to me. It's all good and well for certain people to cry others are unreasonable because their arguments are getting heated (or trying to communicate on mobile while out doing other things) but calm, surreptitious irrationality is no different in my book.

I would've participated in the earlier protest had I been home and able to do so. It was justified.

I would also like to state I agree with @TrumpVoter1 that categories should not be applied to ALL and only the user's HOMEPAGE, and until this can be implemented and mobile issues resolved, all categorisation should be removed.

post.body:
Hi guys Kek responded to some of our concerns tonight and I went to the discord to talk a little more and get some confirmation.

All Ruqqus categories will be fixed to be turn on and not hidden by default:

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

body: I've never been exiled from *any* guild before and I was by far not the only one posting memes. Also I am by far not a fucking child don't condescend to me as if I am, my speech is my speech and I speak it as I fucking damned well please as I see fit and always will , my record stands on its own. No priors. If I'm going to be treated like it's a fucking *mercy* for a bad boy I don't want it. . "No memes" is not a rule for that guild as far as I have ever known. A warning would have sufficed. I don't feel I did anything wrong at all, and don't deserve treatment like that after going out of my way for a long time promoting and helping the site.

post.body:
Hi guys Kek responded to some of our concerns tonight and I went to the discord to talk a little more and get some confirmation.

All Ruqqus categories will be fixed to be turn on and not hidden by default:

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

body: What would you want them to say then? I don't think they have always been clear or upfront, but I think that's understood as a mistake. I kek said before the protest today they were already planning on fixing that and making changes. I believe in people having the chance to recover from mistakes. I have talked to kek and have some good reason to believe in things getting fixed. I would like to see a good solution, because who really wants to leave ruqqus?

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

body:
I don't care what they say because they're lying faggots.

I want them to

- delete the stupid fucking category system that discord trannies demanded

- delete the discord tranny server

- start banning their discord tranny buddies for the shit that they ban other people for

- stop banning people for the shit they let their discord tranny buddies get away with

- stop doing shit like [leaking ban notices to discord trannies](https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/66ia/the-admins-literally-discuss-site-bans) so discord trannies can siege racist guilds and fill them with faggot shit

- If they need an offsite chat system, set up an uncensored chat on an uncensored service where pro-free-speech people can participate

- unban everyone from every guild they run and stop banning people from those guilds for hurting their faggot feelings

- listen to the people who want an uncensored free speech site instead of discord trannies who hate free speech

- stop censoring their fake free-speech site like a bunch of revolting faggots

Do that and keep doing that and eventually I'll have the tiniest shred of respect for them again, but until them I'm going to call them stupid faggots regardless of what they say, because **they're fucking liars** and liars **lie about shit**.

body:
*That* is a debatable issue. Not worth 4 or 5 separate posts in the same guild making the same point, but it's valid. 

Imo hiding some posts behind an easily-accessible filter is not censorship. It'd be better if the filter were more clearly disclosed, however - I'll admit that much. 

The new system described in this thread, in which new users select categories from the beginning, is a good compromise between our two positions.
body_html:
That is a debatable issue. Not worth 4 or 5 separate posts in the same guild making the same point, but it's valid.

Imo hiding some posts behind an easily-accessible filter is not censorship. It'd be better if the filter were more clearly disclosed, however - I'll admit that much.

The new system described in this thread, in which new users select categories from the beginning, is a good compromise between our two positions.

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

parent.body:
*That* is a debatable issue. Not worth 4 or 5 separate posts in the same guild making the same point, but it's valid. 

Imo hiding some posts behind an easily-accessible filter is not censorship. It'd be better if the filter were more clearly disclosed, however - I'll admit that much. 

The new system described in this thread, in which new users select categories from the beginning, is a good compromise between our two positions.

parent.body:
Thank you Stars. For the record I still don't see the point with this change. ALL was not broken. We as users have the ability to filter the users and guilds we don't want to see already and this "fix" does not add to that but does give the admins reddit level power to censor should they so desire. This is completely against their stated free speech principles for Ruqqus.

I have stated multiple times now that dev work of this kind should focus on home to give us more customization. And if categorizations are to be used then apply the functionality for searching guilds by this categorization only just so users can discover similar guilds to subscribe too. Otherwise they make ZERO sense as ALL should be for everything by default unless the end goal is censorship or content manipulation. Just clarifying what the admins are going to do with categories does not go far enough to resolve this as long as they still exist and are still relevant to ALL.

I am sure others feel similarly here on this.

parent.body:
*That* is a debatable issue. Not worth 4 or 5 separate posts in the same guild making the same point, but it's valid. 

Imo hiding some posts behind an easily-accessible filter is not censorship. It'd be better if the filter were more clearly disclosed, however - I'll admit that much. 

The new system described in this thread, in which new users select categories from the beginning, is a good compromise between our two positions.

body:
It's not a punishment - it's how the system was going to work moving forward until a bunch of people complained. 

You were not targeted. You miscategorized your guild, it was corrected, and its correct category was hidden from +All. That's all there is to it. There's room for debate in the matter of whether political / offensive content should be filtered out of +All by default...but you were not targeted. Please stop acting as if you were specifically antagonized by the staff.
body_html:

You were not targeted. You miscategorized your guild, it was corrected, and its correct category was hidden from +All. That's all there is to it. There's room for debate in the matter of whether political / offensive content should be filtered out of +All by default...but you were not targeted. Please stop acting as if you were specifically antagonized by the staff.

body:
I believe the reason behind giving users the ability to filter categories in searching all is about finding new content that's similar. I heard a suggestion about searching by just one category. I have suggested a Discover tab. 

I think some bad actions have been done and some trust and good will was lost, but I think now is a good time to regroup before any real bridges are burned and make an attempt at working to make it right.
body_html:
I believe the reason behind giving users the ability to filter categories in searching all is about finding new content that's similar. I heard a suggestion about searching by just one category. I have suggested a Discover tab.

parent.body:
Thank you stars. This all sounds like it is heading in the right direction.

My concern from today is that @DarkForge was targeted for "recategorisation" before the category reset to all "on" had taken place. What could be the reason for this? @sfrohne can confirm this and that there was a "glitch" in the mod logs that did not show who had changed the category of DarkForge's guild.

It is always a good thing to call for a truce - no one wants a war. But the above actions do not demonstrate good faith or common sense to me. It's all good and well for certain people to cry others are unreasonable because their arguments are getting heated (or trying to communicate on mobile while out doing other things) but calm, surreptitious irrationality is no different in my book.

I would've participated in the earlier protest had I been home and able to do so. It was justified.

I would also like to state I agree with @TrumpVoter1 that categories should not be applied to ALL and only the user's HOMEPAGE, and until this can be implemented and mobile issues resolved, all categorisation should be removed.
parent.body_html:
Thank you stars. This all sounds like it is heading in the right direction.

My concern from today is that @DarkForge was targeted for "recategorisation" before the category reset to all "on" had taken place. What could be the reason for this? @sfrohne can confirm this and that there was a "glitch" in the mod logs that did not show who had changed the category of DarkForge's guild.

It is always a good thing to call for a truce - no one wants a war. But the above actions do not demonstrate good faith or common sense to me. It's all good and well for certain people to cry others are unreasonable because their arguments are getting heated (or trying to communicate on mobile while out doing other things) but calm, surreptitious irrationality is no different in my book.

I would've participated in the earlier protest had I been home and able to do so. It was justified.

I would also like to state I agree with @TrumpVoter1 that categories should not be applied to ALL and only the user's HOMEPAGE, and until this can be implemented and mobile issues resolved, all categorisation should be removed.

post.body:
Hi guys Kek responded to some of our concerns tonight and I went to the discord to talk a little more and get some confirmation.

All Ruqqus categories will be fixed to be turn on and not hidden by default:

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

parent.body: I've never been exiled from *any* guild before and I was by far not the only one posting memes. Also I am by far not a fucking child don't condescend to me as if I am, my speech is my speech and I speak it as I fucking damned well please as I see fit and always will , my record stands on its own. No priors. If I'm going to be treated like it's a fucking *mercy* for a bad boy I don't want it. . "No memes" is not a rule for that guild as far as I have ever known. A warning would have sufficed. I don't feel I did anything wrong at all, and don't deserve treatment like that after going out of my way for a long time promoting and helping the site.

No priors. If I'm going to be treated like it's a fucking mercy for a bad boy I don't want it. . "No memes" is not a rule for that guild as far as I have ever known. A warning would have sufficed. I don't feel I did anything wrong at all, and don't deserve treatment like that after going out of my way for a long time promoting and helping the site.

post.body:
Hi guys Kek responded to some of our concerns tonight and I went to the discord to talk a little more and get some confirmation.

All Ruqqus categories will be fixed to be turn on and not hidden by default:

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

parent.body:
It's not a punishment - it's how the system was going to work moving forward until a bunch of people complained. 

You were not targeted. You miscategorized your guild, it was corrected, and its correct category was hidden from +All. That's all there is to it. There's room for debate in the matter of whether political / offensive content should be filtered out of +All by default...but you were not targeted. Please stop acting as if you were specifically antagonized by the staff.

body: Fixing the category issue and shadow bans it currently does misses the whole point of the issue. This is just putting a bandaid on the proverbial gunshot and letting the patient go home. If they really want to control content and censor us then be honest about it and we can do what we feel is best but don't implement the function that can easily enable this behavior and tell us to trust them. All of us refugees from elsewhere know where this leads

post.body:
Hi guys Kek responded to some of our concerns tonight and I went to the discord to talk a little more and get some confirmation.

All Ruqqus categories will be fixed to be turn on and not hidden by default:

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

post.body:
Hi guys Kek responded to some of our concerns tonight and I went to the discord to talk a little more and get some confirmation.

All Ruqqus categories will be fixed to be turn on and not hidden by default:

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

Hi guys Kek responded to some of our concerns tonight and I went to the discord to talk a little more and get some confirmation.

All Ruqqus categories will be fixed to be turn on and not hidden by default:

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

parent.body:
Thank you Stars. For the record I still don't see the point with this change. ALL was not broken. We as users have the ability to filter the users and guilds we don't want to see already and this "fix" does not add to that but does give the admins reddit level power to censor should they so desire. This is completely against their stated free speech principles for Ruqqus.

I have stated multiple times now that dev work of this kind should focus on home to give us more customization. And if categorizations are to be used then apply the functionality for searching guilds by this categorization only just so users can discover similar guilds to subscribe too. Otherwise they make ZERO sense as ALL should be for everything by default unless the end goal is censorship or content manipulation. Just clarifying what the admins are going to do with categories does not go far enough to resolve this as long as they still exist and are still relevant to ALL.

I am sure others feel similarly here on this.

We as users have the ability to filter the users and guilds we don't want to see already and this "fix" does not add to that but does give the admins reddit level power to censor should they so desire. This is completely against their stated free speech principles for Ruqqus.

I have stated multiple times now that dev work of this kind should focus on home to give us more customization. And if categorizations are to be used then apply the functionality for searching guilds by this categorization only just so users can discover similar guilds to subscribe too. Otherwise they make ZERO sense as ALL should be for everything by default unless the end goal is censorship or content manipulation. Just clarifying what the admins are going to do with categories does not go far enough to resolve this as long as they still exist and are still relevant to ALL.

I am sure others feel similarly here on this.

Hi guys Kek responded to some of our concerns tonight and I went to the discord to talk a little more and get some confirmation.

All Ruqqus categories will be fixed to be turn on and not hidden by default:

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

parent.body: Fixing the category issue and shadow bans it currently does misses the whole point of the issue. This is just putting a bandaid on the proverbial gunshot and letting the patient go home. If they really want to control content and censor us then be honest about it and we can do what we feel is best but don't implement the function that can easily enable this behavior and tell us to trust them. All of us refugees from elsewhere know where this leads
parent.body_html: Fixing the category issue and shadow bans it currently does misses the whole point of the issue. This is just putting a bandaid on the proverbial gunshot and letting the patient go home. If they really want to control content and censor us then be honest about it and we can do what we feel is best but don't implement the function that can easily enable this behavior and tell us to trust them. All of us refugees from elsewhere know where this leads

post.body:
Hi guys Kek responded to some of our concerns tonight and I went to the discord to talk a little more and get some confirmation.

All Ruqqus categories will be fixed to be turn on and not hidden by default:

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

parent.body:
It's not a punishment - it's how the system was going to work moving forward until a bunch of people complained. 

You were not targeted. You miscategorized your guild, it was corrected, and its correct category was hidden from +All. That's all there is to it. There's room for debate in the matter of whether political / offensive content should be filtered out of +All by default...but you were not targeted. Please stop acting as if you were specifically antagonized by the staff.

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

parent.body: I think they have working to make the site easier to find certain types of content per user's wishes to discover, and I also think they want to show new users less racist content. Kek wants to implement an onboarding process that shows all categories and let's people first select what they'd like to see upfront. To them that probably means getting them faster to the content they want to see.

post.body:
Hi guys Kek responded to some of our concerns tonight and I went to the discord to talk a little more and get some confirmation.

All Ruqqus categories will be fixed to be turn on and not hidden by default:

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

parent.body:
Thank you Stars. For the record I still don't see the point with this change. ALL was not broken. We as users have the ability to filter the users and guilds we don't want to see already and this "fix" does not add to that but does give the admins reddit level power to censor should they so desire. This is completely against their stated free speech principles for Ruqqus.

I have stated multiple times now that dev work of this kind should focus on home to give us more customization. And if categorizations are to be used then apply the functionality for searching guilds by this categorization only just so users can discover similar guilds to subscribe too. Otherwise they make ZERO sense as ALL should be for everything by default unless the end goal is censorship or content manipulation. Just clarifying what the admins are going to do with categories does not go far enough to resolve this as long as they still exist and are still relevant to ALL.

I am sure others feel similarly here on this.

body:
As much as we might hate it, the easiest way to make words have less power is to use them. 

In the  1700's, "biting your thumb" in someone's direction  was equal to flipping them off

Now who the fuck cares if you bite your thumb? NO ONE.  In 200 years the middle finger will be replaced by the right nipple or some shit and "down to fuck" will be a romantic term of endearment.

Don't use those words if they upset you,  **but ignore them at your own peril.**

Ignorance serves no one.  

 We need to explore and learn about ALL ideas -  **ESPECIALLY about those things that upset us**

You wouldn't read a repair manual in the dark - you can't fix issues  without shining a light on them.
body_html:
As much as we might hate it, the easiest way to make words have less power is to use them.

In the 1700's, "biting your thumb" in someone's direction was equal to flipping them off

Now who the fuck cares if you bite your thumb? NO ONE. In 200 years the middle finger will be replaced by the right nipple or some shit and "down to fuck" will be a romantic term of endearment.

Don't use those words if they upset you, but ignore them at your own peril.

Ignorance serves no one.

We need to explore and learn about ALL ideas - ESPECIALLY about those things that upset us

You wouldn't read a repair manual in the dark - you can't fix issues without shining a light on them.

post.body:
Hi guys Kek responded to some of our concerns tonight and I went to the discord to talk a little more and get some confirmation.

All Ruqqus categories will be fixed to be turn on and not hidden by default:

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides.

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from.

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between
post.title: Hoping to provide some clarity for users after talking to Admin Kek

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

body: Just going to say there are those who are not very vocal who are paying attention as well.  Not vocal does not mean apathetic.  Also, while it seems you have good intentions, hearing any such second hand is not convincing.  I have seen a few of the admin responses elsewhere and believe you are correct, but others posting here have valid concerns as well.  I think categorizing is something that looks good on the surface, but ultimately requires an authoritarian bent to enforce that is rather against the spirit of this site.  You can already see the issues- if self categorization works, there would not be "miscategorization".  And if admins dictate categorization, people will cry censorship.

Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

body:
they're so disingenuous and double-faced it's not even funny

as cap was apologising for "going too far" he was implementing category lock to better do just what he was apologising for, and he has already been overriding and locking categories

declares intent, then says "it's a rumour", then goes on and works on it and puts it in place- as he does this, he doubles down in the boards and attacks the character of those who complain

their intent is clear, and the messaging is simply damage control to try to get resisting users leaving on their own, keeping a facade of "freedom of speech" that is completely fake

the trajectory is clear

those of us who have been putting effort in trying this to be a true FoS discussion site open to everybody, we're getting demoralised - and it seems to be their intention; so now I've been recommending the site for months, making suggestions, trying to find solutions to problems, testing the site, looking into the code to find problems before nefarious actors would, etc etc what is the point?

the journey leads to purple reddit because admins are not unanimous in defending the agency of users, against the idea of *targeting certain users* to either make them leave or prevent them from joining, against the idea of *altering the organic activity of the site towards a predetermined, therapeutic collective goal*, etc things that should be pretty obviously non-negotiable to anybody who has studied and observed O'Sullivan's Law happening in all discussion sites like clockwork, and understand why

\*typo

I also think other users have valid concerns. I think everyone should come to their own conclusions and also talk to the admins civilly. This is a big discussion on how the site operates. And if it matters to people how it runs, they should speak up.

I think my ideal compromise is this:

https://ruqqus.com/+Commentary/post/66hn/hoping-to-provide-some-clarity-for/lkrl

parent.body: Just going to say there are those who are not very vocal who are paying attention as well.  Not vocal does not mean apathetic.  Also, while it seems you have good intentions, hearing any such second hand is not convincing.  I have seen a few of the admin responses elsewhere and believe you are correct, but others posting here have valid concerns as well.  I think categorizing is something that looks good on the surface, but ultimately requires an authoritarian bent to enforce that is rather against the spirit of this site.  You can already see the issues- if self categorization works, there would not be "miscategorization".  And if admins dictate categorization, people will cry censorship.

post.body:
Hi guys Kek responded to some of our concerns tonight and I went to the discord to talk a little more and get some confirmation.

All Ruqqus categories will be fixed to be turn on and not hidden by default:

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

parent.body:
they're so disingenuous and double-faced it's not even funny

as cap was apologising for "going too far" he was implementing category lock to better do just what he was apologising for, and he has already been overriding and locking categories

declares intent, then says "it's a rumour", then goes on and works on it and puts it in place- as he does this, he doubles down in the boards and attacks the character of those who complain

their intent is clear, and the messaging is simply damage control to try to get resisting users leaving on their own, keeping a facade of "freedom of speech" that is completely fake

the trajectory is clear

those of us who have been putting effort in trying this to be a true FoS discussion site open to everybody, we're getting demoralised - and it seems to be their intention; so now I've been recommending the site for months, making suggestions, trying to find solutions to problems, testing the site, looking into the code to find problems before nefarious actors would, etc etc what is the point?

the journey leads to purple reddit because admins are not unanimous in defending the agency of users, against the idea of *targeting certain users* to either make them leave or prevent them from joining, against the idea of *altering the organic activity of the site towards a predetermined, therapeutic collective goal*, etc things that should be pretty obviously non-negotiable to anybody who has studied and observed O'Sullivan's Law happening in all discussion sites like clockwork, and understand why

\*typo

post.body:
Hi guys Kek responded to some of our concerns tonight and I went to the discord to talk a little more and get some confirmation.

All Ruqqus categories will be fixed to be turn on and not hidden by default:

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between

body:
Many users don't even know they have to select the hidden categories... this is effectively shadowbanning.

Changing Klen's guild categories before they apply the cat reset to "on" for everything is not acting in good faith.

Why not wait until after they apply the fix? If they're so busy, how did they have time to change his categories?

There is no way to rationalise this behaviour. It's too many actions, too many times.
body_html:

Changing Klen's guild categories before they apply the cat reset to "on" for everything is not acting in good faith.

Why not wait until after they apply the fix? If they're so busy, how did they have time to change his categories?

There is no way to rationalise this behaviour. It's too many actions, too many times.

body:
Well there are multiple people involved. Kek didnt agree with Captain changing stuff and hasnt been a part of that. 

Kek said they will all be turned on by default, but they havent been able to fix. The admins are on the east coast and also have to sleep and have day jobs. I can be patient until they fix the categories issues.

post.body:
Hi guys Kek responded to some of our concerns tonight and I went to the discord to talk a little more and get some confirmation.

All Ruqqus categories will be fixed to be turn on and not hidden by default:

https://ruqqus.com/+FragileRuqqusAdmin/post/66cp/the-admins-just-deleted-nearly-every/libi

Kek is working on an onboarding process for new users to select from all categories on entry to start with, as another user is suggesting:

https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/65gz/suggestion-for-a-different-way-to

You can discuss that on ruqqus in the comments of that post.

Kek plans to have an admin post addressing and clarifying this soon and fixing current issues that are happening.

Kek said he doesn't hate the users here, but as one might expect doesn't really like the namecalling slurs and feels some users can't be reasoned with. Let's everyone try to dial the intensity back and have a reasonable discussion so you can be taken seriously and remove bad blood from both sides. 

If I may, let's call a truce. For me what I've asked for has been clarified. No categories will be hidden on default, though new users can see and select from which categories they would like to start seeing content from. 

EDIT: see my proposed solution here:

https://ruqqus.com/+BetaFeedback/post/66zy/my-idea-for-a-compromise-between
